intro: Cuniculotinus, commonly known as the false bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from blue to purple. The plants are perennial herbs with opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. They are native to various regions in Europe, Asia, and North Africa. Cuniculotinus species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
